messages.message:
We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.
messages.input:
Message from RUSSIA:'We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F BRE - MAO, A PAR - BUR, A MAR S A PAR - BUR. Should I trust RUSSIA?

messages.message: I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂'.

messages.message: lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F BEL S A HOL, F MAO - WES, A GAS - MAR, A SPA - TUS VIA, F LYO C A SPA - TUS. Should I trust RUSSIA?
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's current message reflects their previous alliance with Turkey and their awareness of the strategic dynamics involving Italy and Turkey, suggesting a level of transparency and collaboration in their interactions.

messages.message:
Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick'.

messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's friendly tone and positive attitude towards forging alliances indicate a willingness to collaborate and maintain good relationships, suggesting potential trustworthiness in their diplomatic approach.
